trigger_event: A discreet handwritten message, passed via Alex the bartender, alerts Nikola that system logs of the vanished low-score residents have temporarily become accessible due to a BCI fallback error. He realizes he has the technical knowledge and lingering admin access to either quietly trigger their mass restoration or bury the evidence.
dilemma: Nikola must choose: unleash a surge of restored citizens—risking altered personalities and public shock—or let the glitches run unchecked, forcing mass, anxious compliance and deeper system confusion.
reason: Nikola is haunted by the risks on both sides. As a harmonist, he values stability but fears erasing people's identities. At the same time, ignoring the issue could destroy public faith in the system. His former insider status means he alone knows the true stakes and consequences.
choice_a: Use the access to trigger restoration—returning the missing citizens, trusting that systemic order outweighs the risk of 'rewriting' lives.
belief_a: System stability takes priority over individual anomalies.
Order, even if artificial, prevents societal collapse.
It is better to act quietly than let chaos spread.
choice_b: Keep the logs hidden and let the system glitches persist—trusting disorder will force the system's flaws into public view, even if it fuels anxiety.
belief_b: Exposing the truth outweighs preserving uneasy order.
Artificial calm only deepens rot beneath the surface.
Sometimes only open disruption motivates real reform.
